item.title: Me:: we have great conversations but no way of truly capturing them I agree 2020:: Max Krieger:: Chapter 1 | Chatting with Glue
item.description: Discovered: Jan 8, 2025 17:41 Me:: we have great conversations but no way of truly capturing them I agree 2020:: Max Krieger:: Chapter 1 ¬¶ Chatting with Glue <‚Äì QUOTE: Our conversations have a memory problem...online and offline <‚Äì Read the whole five part comic thing: 2020:: Max Krieger:: Chapter 1 ¬¶ Chatting with Glue

item.title: ahmed-musallam:: How to compress a PDF with ghostscript
item.description:
Discovered: Jan 8, 2025 15:08 ahmed-musallam:: How to compress a PDF with ghostscript

gs -q -dNOPAUSE -dBATCH -dSAFER -sDEVICE=pdfwrite \
-dCompatibilityLevel=1.3 -dPDFSETTINGS=/screen -\
dEmbedAllFonts=true -dSubsetFonts=true \
-dColorImageDownsampleType=/Bicubic \
-dColorImageResolution=144 \
-dGrayImageDownsampleType=/Bicubic -dGrayImageResolution=144 \
-dMonoImageDownsampleType=/Bicubic -dMonoImageResolution=144 \
-sOutputFile=out.pdf inputfile.pdf

item.title: Me: Spreadsheets are the number 1 programming language. HTML is number 2 because not everybody can code in HTML unlike spreadsheets Tim Carmody:: HTML Is Actually a Programming Language. Fight Me | WIRED
item.description:
Discovered: Jan 8, 2025 07:33 Me: Spreadsheets are the number 1 programming language. HTML is number 2 because not everybody can code in HTML unlike spreadsheets Tim Carmody:: HTML Is Actually a Programming Language. Fight Me ¬¶ WIRED <‚Äì QUOTE: What other programmers might say dismissively is something HTML lovers embrace: Anyone can do it. Whether we‚Äôre using complex frameworks or very simple tools, HTML‚Äôs promise is that we can build, make, code, and do anything we want. <‚Äì RTWH: Tim Carmody:: HTML Is Actually a Programming Language. Fight Me ¬¶ WIRED (non paywalled)

Previously

  • December 26, 2024: Me: It would be wonderful if we all could write and modify software that‚Äôs better than today‚Äôs world of mass software development which is spreadsheets and things like Hypercard Geoffrey Litt:: Malleable software in the age of LLMs

item.title: Manton Reece:: no agents & unattended algorithms - AI prompts vs. agents
item.description:
Discovered: Jan 7, 2025 11:51 Manton Reece:: no agents & unattended algorithms - AI prompts vs. agents <‚ÄìI agree, for now :-) ! Since for now they are not AGI and unless there‚Äôs a breakthrough AGI doesn‚Äôt look like it will happen anytime soon (i.e. before 2030) but hey I could be wrong :-)

QUOTE

Read the whole thing: AI prompts vs. agents

This isn‚Äôt even the most insane story you could imagine. Many of the examples of AI threatening humanity are actually agents. AI that runs our military, power plants, or transportation with little human oversight.

In generative AI, the ‚Äúprompt‚Äù has a big influence on the quality of the output. Not just the prompt you see when typing into ChatGPT, but also the hidden prompts behind the scenes to guide the AI in the right direction.

The prompt isn‚Äôt always something you type directly. It could be automatically triggered, for example to analyze keywords for a photo that was uploaded. But the prompt should be tied to a user action. The prompt puts humans in control. Ask a question, get an answer, review it, take action. Agents will attempt to collapse that workflow, in some cases replacing the human‚Äôs role in reviewing and taking action. This is dangerous.

In my own use and work in Micro.one and Micro.blog, I plan to draw a line here. No agents. No unattended algorithms, as I wrote in my book. I hope this approach will help us use AI effectively without getting lost.

item.title: Recipes that will probably work :-) :: Pailin Chongchitnant:: Vegan Pad Thai Recipe (that Thai people actually eat)
item.description: Discovered: Jan 7, 2025 07:33 Recipes that will probably work :-) :: Pailin Chongchitnant:: Vegan Pad Thai Recipe (that Thai people actually eat) <‚Äì QUOTE: When I was thinking about coming up with a vegan version of pad thai, it dawned on me that pad mee korat was basically it. While pad thai necessarily contains fish sauce and eggs, pad mee korat doesn't need either of those things, but it has that same sweet-salty-sour profile. Bingo!

item.title: Recipes that work:: Caroline's Cooking:: German red cabbage with apples (Rotkohl)
item.description: Discovered: Jan 7, 2025 07:23 Recipes that work:: Caroline‚Äôs Cooking:: German red cabbage with apples (Rotkohl) <‚Äì We made it with a heaping teaspoon of apricot jam. And we only simmered the cabbage for 15 minutes instead of 30. Smelled like the delicious food I had in Germany :-)

For newer devices, we need more time to work around a new security mitigation.

item.title: Me:: We can suppress any viral disease if we have the will via: multiple vaccinations, clean air, Five years of the COVID-19 pandemic: An interview with Dr. Arijit Chakravarty
item.description: Discovered: Jan 5, 2025 22:13 Me:: We can suppress any viral disease if we have the will via: multiple vaccinations, clean air, Five years of the COVID-19 pandemic: An interview with Dr. Arijit Chakravarty <‚Äì QUOTE: If you want to avoid making that same mistake again, don‚Äôt put all your eggs in the neutralizing antibody vaccine basket or in the nasal vaccine basket. Don‚Äôt put all your eggs in the evolution-proof basket. It isn‚Äôt going to work. The story‚Äôs going to end the same way as it did last time. ... But if you come in with a multipronged strategy where you limited onward spread from long-term infections, you develop combination therapies for long-term infections, you use the multipronged approach to reduce the viral load, including deploying things like HEPA filters and far-UVC and monitoring viral load in public spaces, now you have a fighting shot. If you then use a variety of different vaccines to really maximize the diversity of neutralizing antibodies at a population level, the odds of slowing viral evolution down to a crawl start looking good.
